sentences.sContent: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.sCn: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.sContent: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.sCn: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

sentences.sContent: ...Changes to next year's funding regime are forcing universities to justify charging students up to ￡9...

synos.tran: 政权，政体；社会制度；管理体制

remMethod.val: reg(统治) ＋ ime → 政权， 政治制度

words.tran: [医] 养生法；生活规则；政体；支配

trans.tranOther: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason
